text:
Union Square (Park): The Lincoln statue being re located in the park. This J.Q.A. Ward work formerly stood at the point where Union Square West and 14th Street joined and past which the Broadway streetcars ran. In the background here is Union Square East (Fourth Ave.) from 15th (right) to 16th (left) Streets.

1929

Berenice Abbott,photo
title: Manhattan: Union Square Park -- Lincoln statue.

text:
Union Square Park.  Photographic Department, N.Y.  Edison Co.
Deposited with NYPL by NYC Park Dept. 1931
title: Manhattan: Union Square - [Union Square Park.]

text:
Manhattan
Union Square
Set apart as a "park" in 1811, no doubt Union Square will go down in history for other reasons than Klein's and the fact that it was once the city's fashionable residential section. At the extreme right is the famous Union Square Hotel, erected in 1870 by the Brevoort Estate.

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Photographs by Berenice Abbott, 50 commerce st., new york city

Title: Union Square, Manhattan  March 20, 1936

Code#1.B.
111 B.I.
title: Manhattan: Union Square.
